chapter.title: &dcache; Webadmin-Interface
chapter.para: This part describes how to configure the &cell-webadmin;-interface which is a replacement for the old &cell-httpd;-service and offers additional features to admins like sending admin-commands equal to those of &cell-admin; to chosen cells.

The &cell-webadmin;-interface receives the information from &dcache; &cell-info; service as &xml; which are parsed and presented. For authentication and authorisation it offers usage of username/password (currently KAuth-File) or grid-certificates talking to &cell-gplazma;. It also offers a non-authenticated, read-only mode.
If you are logged in as admin it is possible to send a command to multiple pools or a whole poolgroup in one go. It is even possible to send a command to any &dcache;-Cell.

From the technical point of view the &cell-webadmin;-interface uses a Jetty-Server which is embedded in an ordinary &dcache;-cell. It is using apache-wicket (a webfrontend-framework) and YAML (a CSS-Template Framework). The application is wired up by a Spring IOC-Container.

section.title: Installation
section.para: To enable your &dcache; to run the &cell-webadmin;-interface your system has to run the &cell-info; service. For the authenticated mode a configured &cell-gplazma; is also required (see also ). The KAuth-File has to be on the same machine then the &cell-webadmin; for this to work. For a non-authenticated &cell-webadmin; you just need to add the &cell-webadmin; service to a domain and configure the port &cell-webadmin; will listen on - webadminHttpPort.

For authenticated mode the host certificate has to be imported into the &dcache;-keystore. In the grid world host certificates are usually signed by national Grid-CAs. Refer to the documentation provided by the Grid-CA to find out how to request a certificate. To import them into the &dcache;-keystore use this command: &prompt-root; &path-odb-n-s;dcache import hostcert Now you have to initialise your truststore (this is the certificate-store used for the SSL connections) by using this command: &prompt-root; &path-odb-n-s;dcache import cacerts Webadmin-interface uses the same truststore as &cell-webDAV;, so maybe you can skip this step.
You can enable the &cell-webadmin; interface by adding the service (&cell-webadmin;) to a domain.
The default value for the webadminHttpsPort is 8444 and for the webadminHttpPort it is 8080. Have a look at the following example to see how to modify these values.

The most important value is webadminAdminGid, because it configures who is allowed to alter dCache behaviour, which certainly should not be everyone: # ---- GID a user has to have to be considered an Admin of webadmininterface # # When a user has this GID he can become an Admin for webadmininterface webadminAdminGid=1000 To see all webadmin specific property values have a look at &path-ods-usd;/defaults/webadmin.properties.
For information on &cell-gplazma; configuration have a look at and for a special example .
After startup of webadmin you can reach it via http://example.com:8080/webadmin. Since webadmin bases on the &cell-info; it takes some time until all values are populated, because &cell-info; needs to collect them first. It is recommended to let &cell-info; run on the same machine then &cell-webadmin;.
